The '''Delaware Department of Transportation''' ('''DelDOT''') is an agency of the [[U.S. state]] of [[Delaware]]. The Secretary of Transportation is [[Shailen Bhatt]].<ref name=deldot/> The agency has its headquarters in [[Dover, Delaware|Dover]].<ref>"[http://www.deldot.gov/home/contact_info/facilities.shtml Contact Information]." Delaware Department of Transportation. Retrieved on October 25, 2009.</ref>
The department's responsibilities include maintaining about 90 percent of the state's public roadways, overseeing the "Adopt-A-Highway" program, [[snow removal]], the Division of Motor Vehicles and the Delaware Transit Corporation (known as [[DART First State]]).
The DART public transit system was named "Most Outstanding Public Transportation System" in 2003 by the [[American Public Transportation Association]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deldot.gov/public.ejs?command=PublicNewsDisplay&id=1456&month=7&year=2003|title=DE Transit - DART First State Garners Prestigious 2003 APTA National Public Transportation System Outstanding Achievement Award|work=State of Delaware|date=July 9, 2003|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref>
DelDOT maintains a 24/7 Traffic Management Center in [[Smyrna, Delaware]] at the State Emergency Operations Center. At that location, they monitor traffic conditions, operate traffic lights, and broadcast on 1380 AM via [[WTMC]] radio.
Since 1969, the agency has also maintained a transportation library on Bay Road in [[Dover, Delaware|Dover]].
On February 18, 2011, Sec. Carolann Wicks, who had been Secretary of Transportation since 2006, resigned.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://governor.delaware.gov/news/2011/1102february/20110218-wicks.shtm|title=Governor Accepts Resignation of Transportation Secretary Wicks|date=February 18, 2011|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref> On March 21, 2011, Cleon Cauley, who had been appointed Deputy Secretary two months earlier, was appointed Acting Secretary.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wgmd.com/?p=19985|title=Cleon Cauley Appointed Acting DelDOT Secretary|author=Kelli Steele|work=WGMD.Com|date=March 17, 2011|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.delawareonline.com/dialoguedelaware/2010/12/02/deldot-gets-new-deputy-secretary/|title=DelDOT gets new deputy secretary|author=Chad Livengood|work=Delaware Online (Gannett)|date=December 2, 2010|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref> On July 5, 2011, Shailen Bhatt was sworn in as the new Secretary of Transportation.<ref name=deldot>{{cite web|url=http://www.deldot.gov/public.ejs?command=PublicNewsDisplay&id=4030&month=7&year=2011|title=Department of Transportation Secretary Bhatt Sworn-In by Governor Markell|publisher=Delaware Department of Transportation|date=July 5, 2011|accessdate=July 8, 2011}}</ref>
